title: What’s in Your Beach Bag?
subtitle: Fashion and housewares designer Heidi Merrick shares her beach day essentials

metadata.excerpt: There’s no such thing as time off for Heidi Merrick, but she’s not complaining. Her father, renowned surfboard shaper Al Merrick, taught her early on the importance of loving one’s craft while still making time to soak it all in. “My dad was very good at what he did and had high standards for himself, but he still took time to go fishing, so to speak,” she says. “I think the example of having a life’s work and living a full life has influenced how I work and how I live.” And for Merrick, that life (and her eponymous fashion and housewares lines) is tied to the beach. “There’s an earthiness and refined simplicity that is inherent to beach people,” she says. While the brand is based in Los Angeles, Merrick’s beach house on the road to Ojai is where she, husband Johnny Johnston, and their two children spend much of their time. “I just love seeing the ocean, and I like the people who live near it,” she says, “people who understand that nature is bigger than we are.”

components.text: Fashion and housewares designer Heidi Merrick shares her beach day essentials

There’s no such thing as time off for Heidi Merrick, but she’s not complaining. Her father, renowned surfboard shaper Al Merrick, taught her early on the importance of loving one’s craft while still making time to soak it all in. “My dad was very good at what he did and had high standards for himself, but he still took time to go fishing, so to speak,” she says. “I think the example of having a life’s work and living a full life has influenced how I work and how I live.” And for Merrick, that life (and her eponymous fashion and housewares lines) is tied to the beach. “There’s an earthiness and refined simplicity that is inherent to beach people,” she says. While the brand is based in Los Angeles, Merrick’s beach house on the road to Ojai is where she, husband Johnny Johnston, and their two children spend much of their time. “I just love seeing the ocean, and I like the people who live near it,” she says, “people who understand that nature is bigger than we are.”

There’s an earthiness and refined simplicity that is inherent to beach people
—Heidi Merrick
